definitions.definition: connected with or about love or a sexual relationship

examples.text: I'm not interested in a **romantic relationship**.
It wasn't even until a hundred or so years ago that the concept of **romantic love** in marriage gained any real popularity.
Like every actor starting out in the business, he longed to play dashing romantic leads.
Why don't you ever give me flowers? I wish you'd be more romantic.
You're getting quite romantic in your old age!

definitions.definition: beautiful in a way that makes you think of love or feel strong emotions

examples.text: It sounded romantic and exciting to work in the Walled City, but few stuck it more than a few weeks.

definitions.definition: having an attitude to life where imagination and the emotions are especially important; not looking at situations in a realistic way

examples.text: When I was younger, I had romantic ideas of becoming a writer.
a romantic notion of living off the land

definitions.definition: used to describe literature, music or art, especially of the nineteenth century, that is about strong feelings, imagination and a return to nature, rather than reason, order and intellectual ideas

examples.text: Keats is one of the greatest Romantic poets.

wordOrigin: mid 17th cent. (referring to the characteristics of romance in a narrative): from archaic romaunt ‘tale of chivalry’, from an Old French variant of romanz, based on Latin Romanicus ‘Roman’. (see romance).
